trinity: There is only one God, living and true, eternal, of infinite power, wisdom, and goodness, the creator and preserver of all things, both visible and invisible. And in the unity of this Godhead, there are three persons, each of whom is God and the full manifestation of the Divine Nature: the Father, the Son, and the Holy Spirit.
jesus: The Son, who is the Word of the Father, true and eternal God, of one substance with the Father, took on human nature in the womb of the blessed virgin, so that two natures, namely the Divine and the Human, were united in one person, never to be separated, resulting in one Christ, true God and true Man, who truly suffered, was crucified, died, and on the third day rose again to reconcile us with his Father, not only for original guilt but also for the actual sins of all men.
holy_spirit: The Holy Spirit, who proceeds from the Father and the Son, is of the same substance, majesty, and glory as the Father and the Son, being a true and eternal God. In the exercise of his divine majesty, he baptizes and works powerfully in believers, sealing them according to the promise for the day of redemption.
sola_scriptura: The Holy Bible contains all things necessary for salvation, so that nothing should be required of any man to be believed as an article of faith, or considered necessary for salvation, that is not read therein or may be proved thereby.
